issues.description: The UML in the problem statement defines Farm.animals as a private attribute ("- animals: List<Animal>") and the instructions explicitly ask for a getter and setter. In the solution repository, Farm declares the animals field as public (public List<Animal> animals;). This visibility mismatch contradicts the encapsulation indicated by the UML and the textual instructions and may confuse students about whether they should implement/use a private field with accessor methods or a public field.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the Farm.animals field private in the solution (private List<Animal> animals;) and keep the public getter and setter. Update any direct usages of the animals field in the solution to use the getter/setter or internal access so the implementation matches the UML and the instructions that ask for encapsulation via getter/setter.
